title: Instructional Design Simulation for Implementing Internal Consistency in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of elementary mathematical concepts (arithmetic operations, fractions, decimals, etc.)
context.additional_context: Learners perform simulations analyzing and reconstructing math textbooks in real classroom settings, while role-playing student-teacher interactions via VR.

learning_goals: Learners apply evaluation criteria analyzing conceptual connectivity within math textbooks with over 80% accuracy.
Learners revise and refine lesson designs reflecting internal consistency in VR simulations at least three times based on peer feedback.
Learners submit (100%) draft alternative educational materials that address limitations of existing coefficient systems in textbooks through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
